sentence.Network_en: This system has universality, expedience to use, and expansibility in practice.
sentence.Network_cn: 该系统在使用中具有广泛性 、 高效性 、 使用方便性和可扩展性.

sentence.Network_en: Moral convictions must out - weigh expedience and buck passing.
sentence.Network_cn: 道德的信念必须重于权宜之计和逃避责任.

sentence.Network_en: The true danger is when liberty is nibbled away , for expedience, and by parts.
sentence.Network_cn: 真正危险的时候是那些为了权宜之计,将自由逐渐的 、 小块的蚕食的时候.

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being suited to the end in view
2. taking advantage of opportunities without regard for the consequences for others

auth_sentence.content: It is also an expedience to demand we take in their poor.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is also an expedience to demand we take in their poor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is also an expedience to demand we take in their poor.

auth_sentence.content: Have we disregarded our history and freedoms for items of personal or political expedience?
auth_sentence.res_content: Have we disregarded our history and freedoms for items of personal or political expedience?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Have we disregarded our history and freedoms for items of personal or political expedience?

auth_sentence.content: Those ideals still light the world, and we will not give them up for expedience's sake.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those ideals still light the world, and we will not give them up for expedience's sake.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those ideals still light the world, and we will not give them up for expedience's sake.
